snippet: Buoyed by strong auto sales and rising optimism about the jobs market, the Dow Jones industrial average was only 155 points away from its highest nominal close.
abstract: Dow Jones industrial average closes above 14,000 for the first time in more than five years, raising hopes for some investors and causing others to worry about an overheated market.
lead_paragraph: Buoyed by strong auto sales and rising optimism about the jobs market, the Dow Jones industrial average was only 155 points away from its highest nominal close.

headline.seo: Dow Closes Above 14,000 for First Time Since 2007
headline.main: Dow Tops 14,000 for the First Time Since 2007
headline.print_headline: Dow Tops 14,000 for the First Time Since 2007
